title: Looking for old Letraset catalogs
content:
ok i'm new here i've asked just a couple of questions here  
i was wondering if there's any letraset catalog online where i can  
see some samples of fonts to have a general idea  
by letraset catalog i mean like one of those old catalog books that had entire  
collections and a diversity of families to see  
thanks in advance
author: jahcoozi

comments.content:
Your best bet is to try ebay for example:  
 [http://cgi.ebay.co.uk/Letraset-Original-Font-Book-Typography-1979\_W0QQit...](http://web.archive.org/web/20120107040920/http:/cgi.ebay.co.uk/Letraset-Original-Font-Book-Typography-1979_W0QQitemZ230006774812QQihZ013QQcategoryZ27322QQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem "http://cgi.ebay.co.uk/Letraset-Original-Font-Book-Typography-1979\_W0QQitemZ230006774812QQihZ013QQcategoryZ27322QQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem")

There is a pdf of a brief contents of a catalogue somewhere online (I've forgotten where at the moment) which is more annoying in its tantalising. I wish I had kept mine. Wouldn't recommend buying old sheets though, they had a short enough life when they were in general use.  
Tim

The Letraset PDF by Ulrich Stiehl is a good start  
 [http://www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#LETRASET](http://web.archive.org/web/20120107040920/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#LETRASET "http://www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#LETRASET")

If you are looking for some of the old Catalogs, just typing 'Letraset' into a bookfinding service gets [quite a list](http://web.archive.org/web/20120107040920/http:/www.abebooks.com/servlet/SearchResults?sts=t&y=11&tn=Letraset&x=24) at reasonable prices.

- Mike Yanega

thanks a lot for all the posts  
i'm gonna check all these links  
thanks again for the help

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120107040920im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Letraset1980catalog_5001.jpg)

My father originally bought this 1980 Letraset catalog back when he was attending the photo-journalism school at Syracuse University. The sample book had a price of $1.00. Dang.

I've kept the thing ever since he got out of college and then collected a number of others. In looking through these books one can easily find a lot of really nice display faces of which there is no "digital" TTF, T1 or OTF version. I'd love to have OTFs of faces like Transmission or Magnificat.
